item.title: Code of conduct
item.description: This code of conduct is developed for the virtual Bioc2021 conference. Social media policy Images and content from talks, workshops, and posters may be shared publicly through social media unless the presenter asks for it not to be. To avoid confusion, presentations not to be shared should be labeled “Do Not Share” on each slide, as should be posters. The Bioconductor conference aims to provide a supportive, collegial, and harassment-free environment Bioconductor is dedicated to providing a supportive, collegial, and harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of:

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Agenda All time is US Eastern Time. All sessions include Q&A time. Time Track Name Monday, 7/27/2020 8:00 AM Community Open breakfast meeting

item.title: Sponsors
item.description: Sponsor Opportunities Interested in sponsoring this conference? Please contact Martin.Morgan@RoswellPark.org Your sponsorship will help increase diversity and representation at Bioconductor 2020 by: Funding travel scholarships for students and postdoctoral fellows. Providing caregiver awards to assist in childcare or eldercare costs (new in 2020). Offering student diversity scholarships to increase participation of underrepresented minorities (new in 2020). Keeping registration costs affordable for academic participants. Three levels of sponsorship are available.
